reviews.text: Portable mortgage but when trying to port they offer 15% less than current mortgage, quoting changes in their lending policies. I guess a good way to sting (ex)customers with an early exit fee. Never again CBS.

reviews.title: Pleasant surprise for existing customer
reviews.text: Customer service were good at dealing with my re-mortgage queries, and it was a pleasant surprise to find that re-mortgage rates for existing customers were better than those for new clients.

reviews.title: Good Rates for existing Customers
reviews.text: Unlike a lot of companies who get you in with low rates for a fixed term, we were pleasantly surprised to get comparably good rates for a new fixed term mortgage, meaning we didn't have to remortage completely and we saved on the cost of moving to another company.

reviews.title: No issues

reviews.title: Good customer service

reviews.title: Great service and staff
reviews.text: I applied for a mortgage with Coventry Building Society and I was very impressed by their service. They were quick, efficient and helpful throughout the process. They offered me a competitive rate and flexible terms. They communicated clearly and regularly with me and answered all my questions. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a mortgage. This review is based on information from various sources1234. It is not intended to be a substitute for your own research or personal experience. Please note that your experience may vary depending on your circumstances and preferences. Received message. Here is a possible review on Coventry Building Society mortgage services: I applied for a mortgage with Coventry Building Society and I was very impressed by their service. They were quick, efficient and helpful throughout the process. They offered me a competitive rate and flexible terms. They communicated clearly and regularly with me and answered all my questions. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a mortgage. This review is based on information from various sources . It is not intended to be a substitute for your own research or personal experience. Please note that your experience may vary depending on your circumstances and preferences.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE COMPANY AVOID AND DO NOT USE !!!!
reviews.text: shocking company offered us a mortgage held till october then when we came back to finalise told us we could still have it then two weeks later someone higher up said we couldnt !! shocking has put us back two weeks and we may lose the house now AVOID USING THESE PEOPLE

reviews.title: Mortgage fraud
reviews.text: Coventry building society used a forged mortgage to steal an OAPs home. He died a scared broken old man. Coventry building society does it really take 10 years to show him the unsigned mortgage he never signed. How long before this is taken down?

reviews.title: Amazing team

reviews.title: Feeble Staff Training
reviews.text: Don't even think of applying for a mortgage with these people if you are a company director. They have absolutely no idea how Ltd companies operate. If you're a sole director and your company has shareholder funds just under a million this does not compute with the Coventry. Feeble training of underwriters and ludicrous questions. They feel they are doing you a favour not providing a service.

reviews.title: Mutual values
reviews.text: Coventry is how a building society should be. It listens to its customers and puts their interests first.

reviews.title: Bad experience
reviews.text: I have applied for a mortgage 3 weeks ago and still waiting for a decision. Keep asking stupid and irrelevant questions. Do not recommend, don't waste your time and money with them.

reviews.title: Great value, great service

reviews.title: Helpful and reasonable

reviews.title: 10-year fix with offset
reviews.text: A mutual, it puts the customer first with maximum flexibility

reviews.title: Great service

reviews.title: Slow, but they get there in the end
reviews.text: Getting a mortgage through Coventry Building Society was a bit laborious. After a quick start, the home buyers survey was conducted and reported on within a week - great! Week after week, we were promised to hear from CBS with an offer, but the offer didn't come for nearly a month. Everything else was ready to go, but the underwriter apparently forgot that he had a few queries that we never got asked. In the end, we got there and although it's early days with the mortgage, everything else has been smooth...

reviews.title: Good product, a little slow
reviews.text: Customer services were always polite and helpful and the mortgage product itself was very competitive, but our application was processed rather slowly.

reviews.title: Best Mortgage Company!
reviews.text: I'm absolutely over the moon with Coventry Building Society. Not only for their competitive mortgage rates for existing and new customers but for their outstanding customer service! 10/10 Coventry!

reviews.title: waste of money
reviews.text: pay 495 in advance and didnt get mortgage! waste of money dont go with them at all.

reviews.title: Shambolic customer service and hopeless internet banking.
reviews.text: Been a member for three years. Not had any problems with them until we went on holiday last year and instead of lifting the block on accessing the account outside the UK (this is a default for them) the manager kindly blocked access to the account completely for the week and the weekends either side of the holiday. Which was not what he had been instructed to do, and which was quite inconvenient. A complaint on return from holiday brought an apologetic phone call from someone in a call centre but nothing in writing. After that, I tried to set up online banking with them. This is a convoluted system requiring you to send off a form to get a password and then get a card with codes to access your account. Two step security. First form went off. No response. Popped into branch to enquire. 'Not received. We'll generate another form'. Second one goes off. Card received. Account unaccessible. Ring to activate account. Get into system. Clunky but manageable. Second time I logged in, system fails to recognise new password, locks me out. Try online password reset. Doesn't work. Ring up help desk. 'You can't reset your password online - your email address isn't registered with us'. Explain patiently that I receive e-mails frequently from the Coventry but to no avail. Third form generated, filled in and returned. No answer. Call into branch. 'Form not received'. Fourth form requested. Has been filled in and sent off. Two weeks now and nothing received back from them. Am just about to ring them and find out if they have fallen out with the postal service as well as me. Then I am going to request details of my direct debits prior to closing the account and opening up one with another provider. Reasonable rates of interest in these penurious times, average customer service, online banking system run by a bunch of sloths. Avoid unless ringing call centres is a hobby of yours.

reviews.title: Brilliant customer service
reviews.text: Recently went in for a mortgage review and the last couldn't of been more helpful, explained all the options Available to us as I find some of the jargon difficult to understand, went ahead with a really good deal, very happy

reviews.title: Competitive Interest Rates
reviews.text: I have a limited access cash ISA with Coventry Building Society and after the last Bank of England base rate cut I was expecting my rate to fall by 0.25% in line with all my other accounts with other banks/building societies. However the rate only fell by 0.15% which was a pleasant surprise. I think Coventry Building Society do try to offer the best possible rates.

You have to, literally either walk to your nearest branch or phone them up! I laughted and asked them if they thought it was 1986. It's very old fashioned! It's a way of putting it. I have now read some reviews of how people have been treated unfairly and it's really made me think.

reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
reviews.text: Tried to withdraw funds using electronic trf but their system defaults to my full christian name so my bank did not recognise it. Told to complete withdrawal form for a cheque. 2 weeks later this was rejected because I opened the a/c online and they need specimen signature. Cut a [very] long story short - am still waiting for funds 4 weeks later. Staff all say different contradictory things. Phone line cuts you off. Poorest I have experienced in a very long time.

reviews.title: Great rates, increases quickly passed on.

reviews.title: MASSIVE FAIL!
reviews.text: Coventry Building Society account number 23683694 Coventry Building Society! I was always talking good way to my friends and brokers.... until I try to port my loan to another property. Coventry you hurt my so much! You broken me, you broken all my dreams all I was working extremely hard for 15 years! You are desgusting how you handle this case with porting my mortgage. I am absolutely broken now and efect my health condition currently! You can't imagine what you did to us. We came so far with selling my house, found the buyer, start proceeding with solicitor, buyer paid for the searches. I Also found property for myself, start proceeding, paid for the searches, so many people was involve with this transaction, brokers estate agents. We all waste money and 5 months from the selling my property to find out that you decline my mortgage. You wasted 2 months waiting and providing information from the time the aplication was sent to port the mortgage. You broke everything... bsolutely everything. We was very soon looking to complete this transaction. So many peope involved witht this one and you decision broke everyone dreams. Buyer received mortgage offer from his lender as well. My broker was working extremely hard in my case. I can't believe you decline. I just still can't believe what you did. I completed with property and after the time I try to sell the property because of the Street I live is unsafe. The people are very danger there and me and my partner we very worry of our safety. We have to always make sure our door and Windows are close all the time. I was attack few times already. We have group of people every evening in front of our house shouting, they are very agresive and doing strange things. We dont see our future at this house and make happy family at that house. Coventry you broke us! In first place you agreed to port our loan to another property and said the offer will bee issued in 48hours then you change the mind and decline. You waste my money i paid for searcher the property I was trying to purchase. What you did to us!

reviews.title: Security matters
reviews.text: The Coventry Building Society take security very seriously. I feel very confident that my money is safe with them

reviews.title: Not The Leading, But The Best For Us
reviews.text: I opened a regular savings account with Cov BS a year ago. This was quick and easy to request online. Forms arrived soon after in the post, which required signatures. I returned these in a pre-paid envelope, and my account was opened in just over a week. Internet banking/log in is scure, and I receive regular emails inviting me to view our statement online. I have telephoned once, and visited in-branch once for unrelated reasons - the customer service I received in both instances was quick, professional and friendly. Email communication is regular, clear, and concise. I also regularly participate in a Coventry BS panel along with other account holders and also Cov BS staff members to discuss all aspects of banking with Cov BS, to participate in polls, and to answer questions (sometimes with the chance of winning a reward). Since opening my regular savings account the interest rate has risen several times in line with the base rate, and this is always acted upon promptly. I have since opened an easy access account. I like the set up of the society and its internet banking, which is easy to navigate, and easy to set up payments to. I feel my money is safe - there are no shareholders to satisfy! On that basis, I have no reason to consider changing to another bank or building society.

reviews.title: Reliable
reviews.text: It helps having a local branch to sort out the wrinkles. On line big recent improvements and responsive to interest rates going up and informing customers.

reviews.title: Overall good

reviews.title: Great rates and options

reviews.text: For both the isa and saving accounts, CBS have promptly raised interest rates to reflect changes to base rate. Some of the best rates out there, especially on the limited access accounts that still allow for 6 withdrawals a year within penalty.

reviews.title: Awesome service and savings rate
reviews.text: Easy to switch accounts, generous rates

reviews.title: Terrible banking service
reviews.text: Ten years of banking with this society counts for nothing. I was locked out of my online savings account and when I tried to reset my password I was told by their system that they had no record of my account. This account held my life savings. I spent 1hr 10mins in their telephone system before someone spoke to me. I went though telephone security only to be told I could not transfer my money into the current account I had used with them for those ten years. I had to make a two hour round trip to try and transfer my money, spent another 30mins waiting to talk to a manager. I did not succeed. I left the branch still not knowing if my money would be transferred. Still locked out of my account I tried to ring again and was told by the recording I was 102nd in the queue! This has caused me so much stress over a two day period, they should be shut down and not allowed to operate until their systems are fit for purpose.

reviews.title: Coventry building society kill OAP
reviews.text: The Coventry building society used a forged mortgage to steal an OAPs home. The court case caused him to stop eating and taking his medication. He died a scared broken old man. Coventry building society does it really take 10 years to show him the unsigned mortgage he never signed. AVOID AVOID AVOID

reviews.title: Regular Saver
reviews.text: We opened our joint account online in April. The whole process took one week, and we were set up with easy to view and manage internet banking. I transfer money regularly to this account from another bank, via internet banking. Coventry BS takes account security seriously, though it is straightforward to access your account. So far I have only needed to contact the Cov by telephone, and that was a query while the account was initially being set up; the lady I spoke with was professional, friendly and helpful. Since opening our account Cov BS have honoured the inflation rises by raising the interest rate some 3 times now (not all banks/building societies do this, and they're not obliged to). I also joined their separate site which sends out invites now and again (via email) to answer the odd survey or question. For one short survey I won £200 in M&S vouchers! I get the impression the Cov genuinely listens to feedback. Cov BS moderators regularly converse with customers on the blog section, and anyone can start a thread - most of the stuff on there is interesting with very few gripes! Sure, it's not the best rate out there, yet I like their set up and their features. They have a lot of accounts on offer - something for everyone, no matter what age. Wish we'd got involved with them sooner.

reviews.title: Very Helpful staff and a great rate .
reviews.text: Been with CBS for quite a number of years always found them extremely helpful , Often one of the best interest rates around.

reviews.title: Received excellent service
reviews.text: Staff Avni Gandhi was very helpful.Provided excellent service.

reviews.title: Devious and incompetent
reviews.text: You want to close an account ?? LOL best of luck. Complain !!! ?? don't bother. Accountable ?? err no .

reviews.title: Best ever experience with opening accounts

reviews.title: The best savings rates available from a major building society
reviews.text: The Coventry frequently launches new savings accounts with very competitive interest rates, especially its fixed rate bonds and ISAs. The management listen to what the members say and work in the members' best interests which is more than can be said for the high street banks and Nationwide.

reviews.title: Great Range of Savings Products
reviews.text: Coventry is probably my favourite Bank/BS. Their Rates are becoming less competitive but I love their Dashboard, the fact that one can view Balances and Transaction without the Phone Call Challenge (only needed to do transactions). I like the new design of the DashBoard and the Range of Products. But I also like that they reach out for feedback from their Customer on how to improve.

reviews.title: Disgusted by their actions
reviews.text: After reading online an article about how the Coventry building society cheated 2 OAPS out of their home of 40 years . The ordeal caused 1 OAP to die a broken man. My wife was appalled by the Coventrysite action and will transfer her account to another Bank. Avoid Avoid Avoid

reviews.title: refusing to close my account
reviews.text: 2 weeks and CBS still refusing to close my account. This establishment think its THEIR money and not the customers money. Ignore them at all costs

reviews.title: You're a criminal
reviews.text: Bad experience at the Highworth branch. Got treated like a money laundering criminal. Was asked to provide proof of a private sale of a motorcycle. I was explicit concerning the sale and when asked how I could provide further evidence the manager said I could've (and I quote) taken a screenshot of the eBay advert. I was astonished. The end result was that they just wouldn't believe the money was from an honest transaction and refused to deposit less than £3000. So I closed my account and went to the Post Office and paid it in there. What makes me laugh is that the manager had no idea about motorcycles and I could've shown him a photo of a pram and he wouldn't have known the difference.

reviews.title: Sharp practice over interest rates and no communication
reviews.text: I opened a Double Access Saver (online) account with the Coventry paying 1.2% interest on 22 September 2020. While preparing my tax return for the 20/21 year, I noticed from the end of year statement issued by the Coventry in April that the account was listed as a Limited Access Saver (online) account paying 0.55% interest. I queried this by phone & was told that the Society had supposedly sent me an email on 10 February telling me of this change. No such e-mail was received. I complained about this, and was told that as far as the Coventry was concerned, it had met its obligations. And so, on the back of a single email, of which I have seen no evidence whatsoever, the Society believes it can unilaterally close a customer’s account and open another one on considerably reduced terms – in this instance a c. 70% interest rate reduction - without first seeking consent. Unlike other financial organisations, the CBS feels no need to ensure that a customer has received an email on such matters by inviting a response. It doesn't believe it's necessary to issue a follow-up confirmation either electronically or via the post. I see that it subsequently ‘reissued’ the Double Access several times in Autumn at a continuously lower interest rate. This in itself doesn't inspire confidence. My extended family & I have been customers of the Coventry for 20 years. It's a shame that, having once traded on its ethical reputation, the Coventry now freely resorts to sharp practices & treats its loyal customers with such contempt. My family will be taking its custom elsewhere. Not that its managers will care, of course.

reviews.title: Good rate

reviews.text: A year ago Internet Banking was easy until I was locked out! Trying to access a new Internet Account proved very long winded and in the end I gave up and withdrew funds except for bonds. Not recommended! M King

reviews.title: Still living in the 20th century
reviews.text: tried to open an account online - the normal way to do it nowadays. All that happens is that they send you an envelope of paper which took so long to arrive I had forgotten that I had made the application. not sure I can be bothered frankly

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.text: Always kept informed - good rates - no harrassing!!

reviews.title: Good savings product
reviews.text: Receive a decent interest rate for saving a set amount each month to be held for a fixed period of time. Easy to set up online. Staff available to talk with on the phone for help and guidance if required.

reviews.title: Savings Accounts
reviews.text: Friendly & very easy to get through to on phone - good if not great rates but talking to real people who are happy to help makes the difference

reviews.title: Fantastic Service
reviews.text: Always looking after our money and giving the best savings rates on the market.

reviews.title: The best
reviews.text: I like Coventry Building Society. They are up to date and offer some good rates of interest across their products. I have recently opened an easy access saver which gives one of the best interest rates out there.

reviews.title: Best Incompetant Building Society 2019 - Coventry
reviews.text: Still waiting for my WEB ID three months after opening an account. Coventry are unable to explain why I havn't received my web id. They can't supply it in branch, on line or by post. In the 21st century this has to be the most incompetant building society ever.

reviews.title: Frustrating to set up and register online
reviews.text: I have just opened a savings account with them and I have never before found setting up and registering for online banking so annoying, long-winded and frustrating! I almost gave up with the amount of paperwork and failed attempts I made! However, the 2.5 % interest is the best I could find on the market at the moment with a maximum of £500 a month paid in for a year.

reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff
reviews.text: Great staff at our local Coventry Building Society - patient and helpful

reviews.title: No brainer
reviews.text: Opened Junior Isa for both my children, they have the best rates and they are a company I trust. Can't go wrong. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Excellence
reviews.text: Both me & my spouse have used this company for a few years & have been consistently impressed by their professionalism, loyalty & savings rates nearly always above those offered by other more lauded & popular organisations who invariably fall down badly in the customer care department. Coventry provide a service for all & do not push their clients down the current road of insisting on internet banking, again unlike the more 'usual suspects'. They cater for all in that they deal in branch, by post, by phone & online. I cant recommend them highly enough & its been a pleasure speaking with their customer advisors.

reviews.title: Genuine customer first approach
reviews.text: The Coventry do exactly as it says on the tin, which is refreshing in this day and age - they put the customer first.

reviews.title: Reliable but difficult
reviews.text: I feel as though my money is very secure with this company, I've had great customer service in every experience but I've had trouble with getting access to my ISA almost every time even though I have the right documentation, it takes a while.

reviews.title: A trustworthy provider of savings accounts
reviews.text: The Coventry Building Society is the only savings account provider I have found that consistently pays good rates of interest, has never tried to move my money into low interest accounts and has never offered me poorer rates than new investors. If only all financial institutions showed such loyalty to long term customers.

reviews.title: Honest and respectable
reviews.text: An honest and respectable company that treats it's customers fairly.

reviews.title: Good service and interest rate
reviews.text: Very easy to set up and transfer in old cash ISA. Great customer service when contacting the bank and good interest rate.

reviews.title: No-brainer!
reviews.text: I've had accounts with the Coventry for many years and have never seen a reason to leave. Their interest rates are generally a little above that of their competitors (vital in these times of such pitiful returns) and they reward loyalty by keeping rates on existing accounts a little ahead of their newer equivalents. Also the Coventry's website is a doddle, even for a technophobe like me!

reviews.title: Good service
reviews.text: I found it easy to set up my account, but it was difficult to initially access the online banking service. Interest rates are reasonably competitive, and the customer service has been good when I've needed to contact them.

reviews.title: Redisign /simplify online/telephone/security
reviews.text: The most obstructive and cumbersome security questions and codes that i have ever experienced. They involve swapping postal communications just to set up and now a new additional code grid has been sent to me. I have given up trying to communicate with them.

reviews.title: Easy Access ISA
reviews.text: Phoned up to open easy access Isa and they told me over the phone that the interest rate was going up the following day which was a lovely surprise and quite unusual

reviews.title: Great face to face service plus online services that actually work.
reviews.text: I have had several complicated transactions to negotiate with The Coventry over the past year and they could not have been more helpful. They followed the death of my father and whilst other companies seemed to make the process even more traumatic , The Coventry went out of their way to make it as pain free and simple as possible . I really cannot fault their customer service

reviews.title: Good interest rates offered, strong security set up for internet account
reviews.text: Good interest rates, good online security - lots of steps for logging in

reviews.title: Really is Easy Access ISA (4)
reviews.text: Easy to set up this ISA on line, but I missed the comment that I couldn't transfer in ISA balances from previous years. When the form came to say I was transferring in this year's ISA balance it was confusing but when I phoned for help they were very helpful. Only drawback? The amount of post I received, each by separate envelope, welcome letter, passcode, letter about transfer, grid for reference on phone queries, etc. I got 4 in just one day! Certainly communicative.... overall happy with service and the interest rate is the best I could find for easy access ISA at the moment.

reviews.title: Friendly staff and good deals
reviews.text: Coverage is not national but that provides it with a more personal feel and a good customer focus.

reviews.title: Good rates and helpful staff
reviews.text: Good range of accounts and a friendly local branch

reviews.title: Fantastic savings account
reviews.text: Great ISA account with a competitive interest rate. Customer service is good when contacting them.

reviews.title: unprofessional
reviews.text: always a problem, unable to talk to manager when asked. Staff becoming 'annoyed' easily

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.text: I have an online ISA savings account which I've had no problems with. It was easy to open, I feel reassured by the high levels of security needed to access the account, and they promptly pay a competitive interest rate on my savings.

reviews.title: Exactly what i want from a building society.
reviews.text: The staff are always helpful and friendly, the branch i use is well laid out and clean and also whenever i carry out a deposit, withdrawal or change to my account, it was done fairly quickly.

reviews.title: Changing Address Problem
reviews.text: I've been trying to change my account address but it is proving very difficult. No response from web forms. Impossible to implement advice from their telephone helpline. I just want to close my account now!
